headline: Easy Homemade Pie Crust
description: This homemade pie crust is Chef John's favorite all-butter, 5-ingredient crust recipe that's flaky and tender and made quickly in a food processor.
name: Easy Homemade Pie Crust
recipeIngredient: 1 cup unsalted butter - chilled, cut into tablespoon-size pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Combine flour, butter, and salt in a food processor. Pulse until mixture resembles coarse crumbs, about 10 (1-second) pulses.
Stir ice water and vinegar in a small bowl.

Pour 1/2 of the ice water mixture into flour mixture; pulse to combine, about 3 (1-second) pulses. Pour in remaining ice water mixture; pulse until mixture starts to come together, about 8 (1-second) pulses.
Turn dough out onto a wooden surface, pat it into a circle, and divide it in half. Form each half into a disc, about 5-inches wide.
Wrap each disc in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes until ready to use.

review.reviewBody: I followed the recipe to a T and it came out too crumbly, not like in the photos. I live on the Canadian prairies. I think our "all purpose flour" is harder than in the U.S. Also the climate is very dry. When I make pie crust with lard I add much more water than the recipe says. A lady who makes pies for the farmers' market told me "You'll think you've got it too wet." but after an hour in the fridge it is perfect. I'll try this next time I make this pie crust, and use 10 tbs. water rather than 7. Incidentally, I've wondered why, on the packet of "all purpose flour" they don't indicate what kind of wheat they are using. All purpose flour isn't the same in different parts of the continent.

I have tried many different pie crust recipes over the years, but never found one I liked well enough to use it again. I have reluctantly relied on commercial crusts and trying not to think about some of the ingredients they contain, in between attempts at home made. I stumbled upon this one today when using up some leftover turkey by making a pot pie and needing a crust with none in the freezer. I was blown away by how good this crust is and my husband kept raving about it . I will search no more and will gladly be giving up store-bought. Thanks so much Chef John!!

I’ve been making flaky pie crusts by hand for years, so I had my doubts about using a food processor to make it. As I get older my hands are no longer able to cut the fat into the crust and this is the perfect solution. Flaky and tasty is how I’d describe Chef John’s recipe! The only issue I have with all butter pie crusts in general is that, although flaky, they’re very hard and difficult to cut. I’m wondering if subbing some high quality lard for a portion of the butter would help soften it enough to make it easier to cut and eat?
Very easy. One of the best pie crust I have ever made. Very flakey.
Followed recipe exactly however after cutting up my butter I put it in the freezer for an hour or so. Best pie crust I’ve ever made!
So easy with the food processor and is delicious. It held together well when rolled out and transferred to the pie plate.
I add in some brown sugar for extra sweetness and it always turns out absolutely amazing. Been my go to for every holiday season!!

I can bake like there is no tomorrow......until I get to pies, particularly pie crusts. I end up with Franken-crust (the ones that are all patched together from the tears). I can't tell you how many crust recipes I have been through and my frustration factor would go through the roof. I think I actually balled one up and threw it across the kitchen I was so frustrated (it was the general direction of the trash can). I tried this one and I was shocked....no fighting, 4-letter words, no frustration a very nice pie crust that rolled very well. I have used a similar recipe in the past but never with these results. I did use a pastry blender to cut the butter into the flour and incorporate to a nice ball. Yes it took longer but it gave me a chance to get a feel for the crust (I was to lazy to get my food processor out - and I was concerned it might be over powered . I have tried cookie dough in it before and it didn't work out well) Old school works just fine if you have the time and don't have a food processor handy.

I was feeling dread when it was time to roll this out due to frustrating incidents in the past, but redemption was had this morning after making this recipe. It is soft, easy to work with and did not stick. The end result was a flaky decadent crust that browned beautifully and was delicious. Chef John never lets me down.

I have tried many pie crust recipes over the years, but this recipe using a food processor is by far the easiest and best I've made. I measured the flour (12 ozs. per the video) and made this recipe exactly as written. The dough was easily made in the food processor and prevents overworking by hand. I like to watch the video first, but the detailed directions, make it a simple process also. The dough was easy to roll out. Since I was making a peach pie, I also brushed the egg wash (1 egg yolk stirred with 1 TBSP. water) on the bottom crust, to prevent a soggy bottom crust. The crust was very flaky and buttery. I usually keep this double pie dough in my freezer to have on hand. Let the dough thaw out in the refrigerator overnight and roll out! This is recipe is my "go-to" for pie crust.
Best pastry crust ever! I weighed the flour (12 oz) like Chef John suggests in the video and it came out perfect. It's flaky, buttery and kind of poofy...I love this recipe.
Easy. Excellent results

This pie crust is wonderful 
Flaky Buttery..
Loved that it was made with a food processor...
I love it very much
Very easy and delicious. For added flakiness I substituted half the butter for lard.
Perfect pie crust! Easy to come together and roll out, flaky and tasty.
Easy to make but I wish the recipe instructions matched the video. I made as recipe instructed then watched the video and it was too late to follow the tips.
I must say, fantastic recipe. I do not have a processor and made this by hand. What a great crust. I made a pumpkin pie as soon as I saw this recipe today.
the best pie crust you will ever taste, and you can do it in the food processor. Yay

This was my first time making a pie completely by myself. I used Grandma Ople's apple pie recipe from this site with this dough recipe. Amazing!!!! I hate cinnamon and neither of these recipes called for it. WOOOOO!!!! The dough was so easy to make and rolled perfectly just follow the ingredients to a T and you'll be fine. Thx chef john!
Recipe's good. Easy to make and fool proof. Way too much butter, though. I used 1/2 cup plus 1 tbsp. I mixed it by hand, adding liquids last.
Used this recipe today and it was perfect. Flaky and delicious. Definitely my new go to!

First time I've made pie crust in 40 years. Read a lot of recipes before deciding on this one. Followed recipe exactly. My dough didn't come together like the video but I continued to work the dough. So glad I did. Put it in the fridge while I made the Chicken Pot Pie filling. After rolling out dough , filling and adding top crust I did the egg wash. Couldn't believe how lovely the crust turned out. If your not experienced in making pie crust, this is a great recipe, be patient with yourself and watch the video. Enjoy

Worked great, gave away my food processor after not using it in 4 years so I used my 6 quart kitchenaid with the KA6L blade. I let it sit in the fridge for 3 hours before I used it. I used Apple Cider Vinegar and it tasted great.

I love this pie crust. I never really knew how to make it before and I started using this recipe in pies and quiches and my MUCH better half loves it. But I do have a question. Has anyone tried a different kind of vinegar than Apple Cider Vinegar? My daughter has some serious allergies to Apple Cider Vinegar, even in small amounts, and I am wondering if anyone has used a different vinegar and liked the results. Thanks. Andrew.
First time making homemade crust. It got rave reviews
Easy, flaky and delicious! I’ll be using this again
I was really curious about the vinegar so I tried it. It was delicious! Made exactly as instructed in my Ninja. I will make this again!

This was my first time making homemade pie crust. I haven't had many store bought or homemade pies so I was pretty nervous on how it would turn out. However, I think it was delicious and I received positive feedback as well! It went so well with this apple pie recipe I had.

Since I had a small food processor, I split the recipe and repeated the processing step twice. I also might have to add more water next time because the dough kept breaking around the edges.

Thank you for the recipe! I never thought I'd be making my own pie crust. Now I feel a little inspired to try other pies and designs.

I had no food processor but do have a kitchen aid mixer. I used the food grater to grate the frozen butter into the flour mix. I have made very few pie crusts in my day and was very worried it wouldn't turn out, however, I must trust Chef John! It turned out so flakey and was great with the "Dad's Leftover Turkey Pot Pie"

I doubled this recipe and it turned out extremely well. The piecrust was very flaky, even with a wet filling, like a pumpkin pie. I did use approximately 1 cup of that 5 cups of flour though for when I rolled out the dough so it didn’t end up drying out the dough.I also used 1 1/2 cups of Crisco shortening butter flavored and then I used 1/2 butter.

This is the easiest and best pie crust I have made and I have tried a lot of them. This is going to be my go to recipe for pie crust from now on. I have made this a couple times now and each time it turned out great!
Best crust I've ever made! Thanks for the recipe!
The only pie crust I used anymore, quiche or apple pies, it's the best. The food processor makes life so much easier and the crust itself is flaky and perfect. Another win from Chef John.
My favorite crust ever! I cut the recipe in half for the apple Tatin- perfect! Light and flaky

I followed this recipe exactly as it was my first time making homemade pie crust. This recipe is PERFECT. I didn't change a thing and the crust came out perfectly flaky. Not too hard to work with the dough either as long as you keep it cold.
This crust is very easy to make, flaky and buttery.

This turned out perfectly for me with 1/2 vegan butter and coconut oil. I thought the dough was too moist but I just floured my surfaces and went with it! Easy to roll and work with and so tasty! I used it for maple butter tarts and I was so pleased. Thanks for sharing!

This is by far my favourite pie recipe, I get compliments on this pie crust all the time. It’s good as is, sometimes I’ll add 1/4 cup of white sugar just to sweeten it up but honestly it does not need it. I don’t have a food processor so I lightly stir everything with my hands once it comes together I separate into two balls and put them in the fridge. This recipe is also good to make ahead of time and freeze a few dough balls and thaw once your ready to use them.
An easy recipe to follow with very good results. I’ve used this pastry in several recipes and they’ve all turned out quite well.
Excellent! Really easy to make. Delicious.
Excellent recipes for peach filling and the pie crust.
I tried making pie crust 2 times before this recipe and it kept falling a part. This recipe is excellent. My pop tarts came out perfectly! Follow the directions and it will be great!

Absolutely the best pie crust hands down! This is the only pie crust I use for sweet and savory pies year after year. It has never let me down and it’s incredibly quick and easy. This flaky, buttery crust always gets rave reviews!

I've always avoided making pie pastry but decided to finally go ahead and try. I followed the directions and watched the video and got a terrific result! From now on, if I make the time, I vow to make my own pastry/crust. Go ahead, do it! It's easy and turns out great!
I made as is - but just adjusted the serving size to cut it down to make only 1 crust. Awesome with homemade peach pie
This is a great recipe. I don’t have a food processor so I just used my blender and pulsed. It turned out great!!!
First of all, I DON'T COOK/BAKE but I made this pie crust with no problem! The pie itself, however, was a disaster
Will use this for all my pie crusts. I have made it as written and also with half butter and half lard. It always turns out.

Spectacular! I made this exactly to recipe except I used a pastry cutter instead of a food processor. This was by far the most successful and tastiest pie crust I’ve made. I made Chef John’s Peach Pie with this crust and I’m already planning the next one.
Thank you! This recipe makes it so simple to put together a fantastic pie crust, which I have struggled to “get right” for ages.
amazingly flaky
Very easy and very tasty! I am happy I found this and totally better than store bought pie crust! Thank you Chef John
Excellant,will be my new pie dough recipe!

Absolutely AMAZING! So easy and flaky and tender and crispy and held the liquid mixture and, and, and.... This was my first time making pie crust! I did it with a food processor and it was so easy! Thank you so much!
I don't have a food processor, so I froze the butter and grated it.

Simple and effective. Was easy to make and kept well for 24hrs in the fridge.
I didn't have a food processor but recruited my toddler's food maker. It required 4 cycles, but the result was great.
Best crust recipe! I use this for all my pies - from chicken pot pie to apple pie. Everyone raves about it!
Easy to follow steps, thanks

My husband does not like sweets... however when I made an apple pie with this crust, he couldn’t get enough of it! Even wanted some for later as leftovers for his lunch. The crust is SO buttery and flakey, we love it! A crust can make or break a pie in my opinion, and this crust surely made our pies turn out very tasty!
No it made a awesome beef pop pie
I made this for my quiche. It tasted great!

Made it by hand because I can't be bothered to wash my food processor. The vinegar really does make this crust soft. Also made with half butter, half margarine to cut back on the costs. I will definitely make it again.

I'm 72 years old and learned to make pie crust with lard. I learned from my mother-in-law who was a wonderful cook. I did not think I would ever use anything but lard until I found this recipe and purchased a food processor. I occasionally still use my lard recipe, but this is as good a recipe and if you have a problem with pig fat, this recipe is an excellent substitute.
Easy and comes out great !
This is a fantastic recipe. I was so proud of how my crust came out. I’ve always struggled with getting the right amount of flakiness with my crust but it came out just perfect.

I may try it again. I'd like to learn to make a crust in the food processor. But this isn't as good as my mother-in-law's recipe that I've been using for years. It is almost too buttery. Maybe I miss the lard flavor that I'm accustomed to using. And, it was very tough, even though I tried to follow the video pictures as to what it should look like when I finished processing. It took a lot of "kneading" to get the dough together, and then there were still many stray crumbs that were wasted.

This is the first homemade crust I have ever made. We loved it and it was so easy using the food processor. I followed it 
just as written and I love that I have a spare for the future.
Delicious!!
Really tasty and flaky pie crust that was easy to make.

Very good! This was my first crack at making pie crust. It took a bit of time to make, but well worth it. The taste is very buttery and it's nice and flaky. My husband thought it was the best apple pie I've made to date! I didn't have unsalted butter, so I used regular butter and did not add salt to the dough. I had to use 10 tbl of ice water because the dough was too crumbly. Next time I will try to use 8 because the dough was very hard to roll out and work with. Thank you!
Required a tad more water than the recipe stated. I slowly upped it with another tablespoon.
First time ever I made good pie crust! even though I guesed the temperature and cooking time... can you please list the correct temperature and time it should be cooked at? thank you!!
THANK YOU FOR MAKING THIS RECIPE AND GIVING DIRECTIONS ON PULSING. I ALWAYS HAD TROUBLE WITH AMOUNT OF PULSES. DIRECTIONS WERE GREAT
Yes! Easy to make and has a fabulous flavor.
Yes! Easy to make and has a fabulous flavor.

Used this recipe for the first time making pie crust and I loved it. 
Thanks for an easy recipe.
easy peasy
I’m not a baker, but this crust turned out great. I froze half of it, and it was just as good 6 weeks later.
Flaky and buttery. I used it for quiche.
Have to say this is my go to pastry, never fails. However I've never been comfortable with volume measures like "cup" so i have converted all the measurements to metric.

THE BEST pie crust recipe. I make Chef John’s pumpkin pie as well and it’s always the first thing to go at gatherings. I’m obsessed with this pie crust because it is perfectly crumbly but enough to hold together while placing it in the pie pan. Keep up the great work Chef John!

I've been in search of this recipe all my baking life. A buttery, light, flaky pie crust to enhance all the hard work that goes into a homemade pie. Look no further everyone. This has a wonderful buttery flavor, and is light and flaky, likely due to the coldness of the butter, refrigerating the dough 30" or more, or perhaps the vinegar. Yum!

This crust is perfect. I went out to buy a food processor to see if the crust would be better than my usual making it by hand. It was! It is flaky and rolls out beautifully. Highly recommend this recipe!
This was easy and by far the best pastry I have ever made.
Easy crust, flaky and very tasty.

Made this twice and followed the recipe exactly - came out perfect! I rolled the dough very thin and it was large enough for a shallow 9" pie dish, top and bottom crust, but be strategic because there won't be much left over.
Buttery, flaky and delicious. Rolls out nicely and is easy to handle. Easy to make in the food processor. A keeper.
Tried my hand in making this crust for my 1st attempt at "Apple Pie by Grandma Ople" recipe. I followed the steps exactly and it came out great. thanks for the recipe :)
This was so easy to make. Next time I’ll use regular salted butter and leave out the vinegar.

I made the pumpkin pie from Chef John Nd pie was amazing but the recommended crust didnt taste as I envisioned. It was not flaky, kind of harder than it should have been. I followed the recipe precisely so not sure what went wrong. I used a food processor.
This crust was AWESOME!! I followed the recipe exactly. It was my first time making pie crust from scratch and it tasted like a seasoned professional made it. Thank you for the wonderful recipe!
For a two pie crust it was great. However, to make a blind crust, there were no directions so far as temperature to cook or time to cook. It shrank badly as I had to guess at both.

No changes...
Everything came together like magic!

Excellent pie crust! It's super easy to make. when rolling it out, be SURE to use plenty of flour. You'll need to sprinkle your rolling pin and the top of the dough several times. I like to roll my dough out on parchment paper.
Thanks Chef John! Hear me out - take excess pie dough and roll out very thin. Cut into odd shapes (or not) and dust with cinnamon sugar. Bake until golden brown. You're welcome. haha

omg sooooo flakey, crispy, tender, and flavorful. every time I make pie I experiment with the crust, but no more. I think the addition of apple cider vinegar does the trick. I did not use the food processor, but my hands. (That’s right, not even a pastry cutter.) I finally achieved my ideal piecrust. Next time I’ll try the food processor and see if it makes a difference.
Excellent crust. Tender and flakey
Excellent crust. Tender and flakey
Easy and exceptional crust
